site_name: Qatar Airways Cargo - IAD Dulles International Airport

citations.narrative:
Qatar Airways could not provide the health certificates for dogs and cats transported in commerce. The Qatar Airways
representative stated that they do not routinely keep copies of the health certificates for dogs and cats transported as
excess baggage. Accepting carriers and intermediate handlers shall keep and maintain a copy of the health certificate for
dogs and cats transported and delivered in commerce. Correct by 07/31/2024.

citations.desc: Primary enclosures used to transport live dogs and cats.
citations.narrative:
Multiple shipments of cats and dogs have been transported from Kuwait, Afghanistan to Dulles International Airport (IAD)
from October 2023 - July 2024 on Flight QR707/QR709, as excess baggage. According to the Centers for Disease
Control (CDC) officers that inspect the shipments upon arrival at IAD, most of the crates the animals were transported in
contained 2-4 cats or 2 dogs adult aged or over the age of 6 months.
- On 09/27/23 Fifty-nine (59) cats were imported for adoption and arrived with 2-4 adult cats per transport carrier.
- On 10/18/23 Forty-three (43) cats were imported for adoption arrived with 2-3 adult cats per transport carrier.
- On 05/01/24 32 cats were imported for adoption arrived with 2-3 adult cats per transport carrier.
- On 05/06/24 Thirty (30) cats were imported for adoption. Three carriers contained 3 adult cats per carrier. Two of the
cats in one carrier were entangled in the plastic absorbent pad.
- On 07/08/24 Fifteen (15) cats were imported for adoption arrived 2-3 per crate. Four (4) adult dogs were imported for
adoption and arrived with 2 dogs per crate.
No more than one live dog or cat 6 months of age or older, may be transported in the same crate when shipped by
airplane. Correct by 07/31/2024.

On 14 February 2024, one male dog, “Chico” (microchip # 990000007942934) arrived from Kuwait on Qatar Airways
Flight QR707. Upon arrival, the CDC Officers noticed that dog’s crate had an empty water bottle zip tied upside down to
the outside of the crate and one empty bowl inside the crate. There should be both a food and a water bowl securely
attached to the inside of a transport carrier. Food and water receptacles must be securely attached to the inside of the
transport enclosure and placed so that the receptacles can be filled from the outside of the enclosure without opening the
door. Correct by 07/31/2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the airline representative.
n

narrative:
2.77(b) 
   
Records: Carriers and intermediate handlers. 
Qatar Airways could not provide the health certificates for dogs and cats transported in commerce. The Qatar Airways 
representative stated that they do not routinely keep copies of the health certificates for dogs and cats transported as 
excess baggage. Accepting carriers and intermediate handlers shall keep and maintain a copy of the health certificate for 
dogs and cats transported and delivered in commerce. Correct by 07/31/2024. 
3.15(f)(1) 
   
Primary enclosures used to transport live dogs and cats. 
Multiple shipments of cats and dogs have been transported from Kuwait, Afghanistan to Dulles International Airport (IAD) 
from October 2023 - July 2024 on Flight QR707/QR709, as excess baggage. According to the Centers for Disease 
Control (CDC) officers that inspect the shipments upon arrival at IAD, most of the crates the animals were transported in 
contained 2-4 cats or 2 dogs adult aged or over the age of 6 months.  
 
- On 09/27/23 Fifty-nine (59) cats were imported for adoption and arrived with 2-4 adult cats per transport carrier. 
 
- On 10/18/23 Forty-three (43) cats were imported for adoption arrived with 2-3 adult cats per transport carrier.  
 
- On 05/01/24 32 cats were imported for adoption arrived with 2-3 adult cats per transport carrier. 
 
- On 05/06/24 Thirty (30) cats were imported for adoption. Three carriers contained 3 adult cats per carrier. Two of the 
cats in one carrier were entangled in the plastic absorbent pad.  
 
- On 07/08/24 Fifteen (15) cats were imported for adoption arrived 2-3 per crate. Four (4) adult dogs were imported for 
adoption and arrived with 2 dogs per crate.  
 
No more than one live dog or cat 6 months of age or older, may be transported in the same crate when shipped by 
airplane. Correct by 07/31/2024.

3.17(c) 
   
Food and water requirements. 
On 14 February 2024, one male dog, “Chico” (microchip # 990000007942934) arrived from Kuwait on Qatar Airways 
Flight QR707. Upon arrival, the CDC Officers noticed that dog’s crate had an empty water bottle zip tied upside down to 
the outside of the crate and one empty bowl inside the crate. There should be both a food and a water bowl securely 
attached to the inside of a transport carrier. Food and water receptacles must be securely attached to the inside of the 
transport enclosure and placed so that the receptacles can be filled from the outside of the enclosure without opening the 
door. Correct by 07/31/2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the airline representative. 
 
 n
